channel.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED]Getting Notified About a Reply To Your Post Through a Simple Process
channel.description:
Hello! I was thinking, "It's such a pain to have to go through my post history to find what I have posted to see if someone replied" so I thought up a simple process to help fix this. How about, to reply to someones post you write
@(username)
to make it even less of a hassle, make a button that says "reply to (username)"
and whenever the @(username) symbol was located in the text of someones post. It would notify (toggle-able) the user with that username that someone has replied to them on (this) post.
Please post your opinions.

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED]Getting Notified About a Reply To Your Post Through a Simple Process
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:2, topic:528927”]so it’s like a “quick subscriber” by putting the username? If I am understanding your suggestion properly…

I like the idea overall. To take it a step further you could do

@(username)(username)

if you wanted to get notifications from more than one.

You could also have it to notify you if anybody quotes what you said. (similar to Vbulletin?)[/quote]

Well not really. Remember the good old youtube reply system? When you hit reply it would start off the reply with @(otherpersonsusername) (text) Thats sorta how I would prefer it.

And its not subscribing at all. Basically, if someone types in @Docent, I would get a notification through email or whatever saying that this person replied to my post on this thread.
